column4: Hello. I'm new to irc, And I was wondering where I might find technical type help.
is there a way to move a linux installation to a different harddrive?
use gparted, install grub on the target hdd, you're done
What I have is a linux installation on a partition on sdb and I want it moved to a partition on sda
great, launch gparted.  It should be pretty obvious how to copy
the only hard part is installing grub.  but you can just google that
Ok, thanks for your help. And how do You like reply to my posts?
You're doing it to me.  You just start with my name.
The IRC client actually highlights it.  There is no set rule, it's more like standard practice.

I just remembered I had tried doing this before and Already have everything transferred to sda. What I was having trouble with is getting grub2 to install on sda and look for its files on the sda partition.
